151111.content:
“I’m glad I met you Mark.”
“Same here Silvia. I feel like… like I love you.
“Well the truth is…

*RIIINNNNNGGGG*

That alarm. That dumb alarm. Just when the dream could’ve actually made some sense, that nuisance destroyed it all. Mark was pissed. All he wanted was to know who this Ninetales was, why he had to look up to her, and why it was so disturbing as to suggest love with a Pokémon. Knowing names would be nice but Mark wasn’t going to push his luck.

Mark got up. He was seventeen, still with his parents, built pretty well, and only a month away from getting out of high school. One strange dream wasn’t going to ruin his mood especially because he had no homework and the weekend had just started. He opened his bedroom door and took a step forward, but ended up going backwards.

“Nice to see you too Torch.” The large Arcanine stood over Mark, and rubbed his face along Mark’s. “Well, you’re probably as hungry as I am. So I’ll get us both something nice.” The Arcanine gave Mark enough room to stand and followed him to the kitchen. Mark opened the fridge and pulled out some pizza from the night before. He pulled out two slices: One for himself and the other for Torch. After checking for his parents, Mark threw one slice toward Torch and the other he nibbled on with a savage bite.

“Mark! Don’t give that food to Torch! It’s not good for him.” “Mom, we eat this as a family and since Torch is one of the family, he can eat it.” Mark’s mother sighed. “Fine then. What are your plans for the day?” Mark took a break from eating to think. “I was thinking about taking a walk in the park and just taking in the fresh air today.” “Alright then honey. Just be back before 6 so we can find a decent restaurant to eat in, since it is for a special occasion.” “Course mom. Well, I’m going now. Don’t be too much trouble now Torch.”

The Arcanine barked with a sly smile. “I wish I could understand you pal, but I can’t. Maybe I’ll be able to someday.” Mark stepped outside of the apartment and started to notice how minimal the traffic was today. Normal city conditions by his standards were for a never-ending barrage of cars to be flying by, but not today. No, the city looked almost abandoned with how empty it seemed. Regardless it just made it that much easier for him to get to the park.

He made it to the park and noticed all the Pokémon scurrying about. But he didn’t mind at all. In fact it was usually all their actions that made city life manageable. He kept walking when a sharp pain hit his head, like someone was crushing his skull. Everything spun and the world slowly fell apart. Mark tottered and tried to keep upright, but eventually fell to this foreign pain and collapsed.
-----------------------------------
Mark stirred and propped himself up on his hands. The day had shifted into night, the trail remained beneath him, and the mid-darkness had created an eerie atmosphere. Something definitely didn’t feel right and not just with the surroundings, but within himself. Mark’s bones ached, his muscles burned, and he felt heavy, yet free at the same time. He stumbled over to a nearby river that ran through the park. He collapsed by the water and splashed some on his face. He heard screams and shouts that fled from the mouths of terrified woman and children. He didn’t know what was happening, but it had to be bad. His eyes fully opened and he gazed upon the reflective water, but the face that looked back at him didn’t exactly thrill him.

The Eevee in the water looked petrified. How could it be that an Eevee’s face replaced him? It has to be a dream. Yeah, that was it, because he had hands and Eevees only have paws. But his once bare hands were now consumed by a silver-toned fur. A tail had sprouted and his ears were much larger. His clothes were gone and left him a naked, yet furry being. That’s when any nearby Pokémon scattered and Mark realized the true problem at hand. He had hands and feet, but the fur, ears, and tail defeated the chance of being human. He had the appearance of an Eevee, yet his height, bipedal stature, and remaining human features shattered the possibility of being considered a Pokémon. He existed as both at the same time and each defeated the possibility of being either one. Indeed he was a three-foot tall, human-Eevee Anthro, unable to be accepted by either species. He fled from the waterfront and sat on a park bench to take everything in.

He wanted to run home, but knew he wouldn’t make it. No one would let a freak like himself into the city, especially not his parents. His parents, what about them? He had to tell them what happened so they wouldn’t worry, but they would never believe him. They would be afraid and probably send Torch after him. He curled up on the bench and cried. All he had; his family, Torch, his academic status, his things, an approaching birthday, his dreams, everything, now decimated and left to blow in the wind. He wanted to wake up and say this was a dream. He wanted to act like this never happened. He wanted to be normal again. But he knew it wouldn’t happen. ‘Everything happens for a reason Mark, good or bad. You can’t change it and you can’t always have it your way. So accept it and move on." He could still hear his grandpa whisper those words. He could still remember that day when he knew he would never see his grandpa again. Mark curled up closer, as though he had something he was cuddling. He knew his grandpa was right, but what purpose would turn into some freak have?

“Mister, are you okay?” Mark snapped open his tear filled eyes, though he feared he would see the girl who the voice belonged to. But in the space where there should’ve been a human stood a Vulpix, and a fearless one at that. “Yeah, yeah I’m fine. Who are you?” “I’m Silvia. What’s your name, mister?”
151111.title: Male Eevee [EDIT]

1511111.content:
“Call me Hybrid.” The former human Mark said. “Hybrid? That’s not your name. It’s too weird to be your name. Tell me!” Silvia said. “You’re right. That’s not my name, but that’s what I’d like to be called.” Silvia looked unsure at first, but then nodded her head. “Okay mister Hybrid. If that’s what you want to be called, that’s what I’ll call you.” Mark managed to find a grin in his sorrow. His body had shifted from something so normal to something so irregular. Now he had a name to match.

“So why are you sleeping on this bench? Shouldn’t you be doing at your home?” Questioned the little Vulpix. “I lost my home, so I’m going to sleep here for the night.” Hybrid said as he adjusted himself to a more comfortable position. Silvia leapt with joy. “Then you can come stay with me until you find your home!” Hybrid suddenly stirred. “Stay with you?! I don’t think so. You have your place and I’ll stay here until I find mine.” “Please mister Hybrid! I want someone to stay with and you need a better place to sleep.” “You don’t live your parents?” Hybrid inquired “No. They wanted me to see the world, so I live alone.”

Hybrid lied there, considering his options. He did need a place to stay and all, but he didn’t want to stray too far from his family. “So, where do you live?” Silvia’s face lit up. “Really? This way!” Silvia took off and before Hybrid had taken two steps, he stopped and Silvia turned around, getting a good look at Hybrid’s true form. “What’s the matter? Aren’t you coming with?” “Yeah. But I can’t walk around like this. I’ll be the center of attention.” “You have four paws, so why don’t you walk on them?” “Oh yeah. Must’ve been sleeping too long.” Hybrid said as he bent over. His stance was solid, but his steps weren’t synchronized at all. “You look like a human trying to walk on all fours.” Silvia said with a giggle. “Yeah. A human.” Hybrid said emptily.

Eventually Hybrid’s steps became smoother and he naturally blended in except for his larger size. Silvia and Hybrid kept walking along the dim streets. The pair moved to the side for a worried-looking couple walking an Arcanine. Silvia gave a friendly hello to the Arcanine, but Hybrid remained. He recognized his parents with Torch. Hybrid just kept walking, trying to kill any desire to reveal himself to his family. Torch however gave him a stern look and a gentle sniff.

“You smell of my master. Do you know where he is?” Hybrid was paralyzed. How could he answer that? He remained still, looking Torch in the eyes. The Arcanine looked with a more irritated gaze. “Where is he? You smell of him.” A few more moments of silence passed. “You’ve done something to him, haven’t you?” Torch was about to strike when the humans called for him. With bared teeth, Torch walked away, whispering to Hybrid “I will find you, and I will either have my master or revenge.”

Nothing moved except the humans and the Arcanine. The humanoid Eevee remained still, knowing with time, Torch would have his way. He could only keep this charade up for so long before Torch found out. “Mister Hybrid, are you okay? What was that Arcanine talking about?” A few moments passed before Hybrid spoke. “I-I don’t know…” “Well then let’s get going!” The Vulpix bounded off again, with the anthro following behind.

After a long hike, the duo came to the city limits and the forest that surrounded it. The forest looked so lively, yet Hybrid felt nervous. So many eyes were watching him, from so many directions. A few more paces though and they came upon a fairly large den carved in the face of a rock wall. “Here we are.” Silvia said as she trotted inside, with Hybrid following closely behind. Initially the darkness hindered any ideas of the interior, but Silvia’s flame soon ignited some sticks that were on the ground and the cave was illuminated. The interior was fairly empty and the only real additions were some cubby holes which served as food storage, the torches, and an old blanket on the floor.

“This is it. What do you think?” Silvia asked as she went to grab some berries. “If it suits you, then it’s fine by me. Hybrid said as he inspected the blanket, still walking on all fours. “Good. Can I ask you some questions, mister Hybrid?” “Please, just call me Hybrid. No mister. And considering we just met and you already took me into your home, I would hope you would.” Hybrid said as he took the berry Silvia offered him. “So, what are you?”

The Eevee had been caught off guard. “I’m an Eevee.” Silvia shook her head. “Well yes, but that’s not it. You’re something else. You can easily walk on two legs like a human and your scent is like two different ones at once. So what are you?” “Well, um, this is going to sound strange, but I’m a human.” The Vulpix stopped for a moment and took a second look. “That makes some sense, but how did you go from human to yourself now?”

“That, I don’t know. I went outside today for a little bit, passed out, and woke up like this.” “So you live in that city with all those other people? What’s it like?” “It’s… Well you see… I don’t know how to describe it. Just people living in buildings.” Hybrid said taking a bite out of his snack. “So do you know those humans we passed on the way?” Hybrid paused. “Those were my parents.” Silvia’s jaw dropped and she got even closer. “But you didn’t even try to communicate with them.” “Because what good would it have done? They either wouldn’t have understood what I was saying or they wouldn’t have believed me. The only way this could’ve happened is if I was born a Ditto, and I know that’s not true.”

No one spoke. No one moved. Everything was still. “You don’t like being this way, do you?” Hybrid sighed. “It’s a mix of emotions. While it’s nice to be able to talk to pokemon and such, I’ll probably never live normally again. I have to adjust to all the changes, I can’t live among humans like I should, I’m too different to be a pokemon, and all I had, I lost. I don’t know anything about what I can or can’t do as an Eevee or how I’ll adjust from what I had to all this new stuff.” “You should stay with me. I can teach you anything you’d like to know.”

Hybrid gave her a questioning gaze. “You’ve been unbelievably generous since we met. You’ve given me shelter and food, accepted everything about me without doubt, and now you say you’ll teach me anything. Why? Why are you being so generous? What about me is so valuable?” “The companionship you offer. I’ve never had a friend or someone to really talk to other than my parents. I moved away from my parents about two months ago and came here about a week ago. I’ve been unbearably lonely.” “And I should trust you? You came to me while I was sleeping. You seem young for your parents to have kicked you out.” “Eighteen human years isn’t that young. I am telling the truth, whether you believe it or not. If you want to leave, you always can. Besides, you followed me all the way here.”

“I’m just checking. I’m barely a day old. I’d rather not make my first day terrible.” “That sounds like a good idea. May I ask more questions?” “Fire away.” Hybrid said as he yawned. “So since those were your parents, was that also your Arcanine?” “Yes and no. Torch could be considered ours I guess, but I don’t like thinking of it like that. He lives with us on his own accord rather than us ordering him around.” “So how did that come to be?” Silvia asked as she got in a more comfortable position. “Years ago, I was walking home and one day I saw a sick Growlithe laying there. I brought him home and the rest is history.” “How many years ago?” “Um. Maybe 9 years or so? Can’t quite remember.” “So do you live with your parents or are you on your own too?” “Well I did live with my parents until I started looking like this.” “So then how old are you?” “Seventeen. Eighteen in a week.” “Really? You seem older.” “Can I ask some questions now?” “One more, then you can. What is your real name?” “Don’t use it too much but my name is Mark. I’d prefer to be called by a name fitting of my appearance. Now, why is it that you seem to be so different with personalities? You were really playful earlier and seemed so young and innocent, but now, you seem older and more professional I guess.”

“I acted professional when I first moved out. Nobody wanted to live with me when I was like that though. So I figured that now that I was somewhere different, I hoped a young look and a young attitude would work. It obviously got you.” “Yes it did. So, do you know where your parents live by human definition?” “Near a city called Lemone. What is this city called?” “ This is Appel. Lemone is about a day’s walk. Is that blanket a gift from them?” “Yep. The humans they live with gave it to them and in turn, they gave it to me.” “That’s nice of them. At least you had a fair chance at goodbye. Are the humans they live with nice?”

She snorted. “Depends on how you define nice. Do they take care of them? Yes. Do they spend time together? Yes. Were they nice to me? No. They didn’t like me there, so that’s part of the reason I’m not there.” Silvia said as she started narrowing her eyes. “Oh. Sorry to hear that. I think I’ll stop asking for now. I’m tired and I’m sure you are too.” Silvia yawned. “Yes I am. Good night.” Silvia said as she crawled under her blanket. “Good night.” Hybrid whispered as he lied on the ground.

It had been hours, but Hybrid really felt no inclination towards sleeping. He was absolutely restless. He stood up and looked at the Vulpix. She was happily asleep, and he wanted to keep it that way. He crept outside on two paws, into the darkness.
1511111.title: hybrid

choices: Silvia and Hybrid head out the next morning
Silvia decides she wants to stay at the cave
15111112.content:
The night was quiet and at peace. However, two individuals weren’t aware of the outside world because the cave they were in was the only place that mattered. The silver Eevee was groaning in pain as quietly as he could, so as to let his cave-mate keep her state of sleep. The snarling Arcanine showed no such sympathy though, as his paw pinned the Eevee to the ground and the pressure he applied only increased with each passing second.

“Where is he?” Torch said. “I told you I’m not sure.” “You still smell like him. How could you possibly not know when you smell as strongly as you do?” The paw only grew heavier and Hybrid’s suffering grew worse. “It’s hard to explain.” “Sure it is. Telling me where he is just so difficult. So then what did you do to him?” “I didn’t do anything!” Torch growled louder and applied even more pressure on Hybrid. The pain had grown too extreme, and Hybrid let out a shout.

Silvia snapped awake from under the blanket and looked around in a daze. Her exhaustion was swept away as she looked upon the familiar Arcanine crushing Hybrid. She panicked, as she tried to decide between Torch’s and Hybrid’s desire. A moment she passed and went with the only choice she felt was right. “Torch! Stop it!” She cried out with passion. Torch’s face froze and his paw took some of the force off Hybrid. He turned his head toward the Vulpix, shooting her a confused gaze. “How did you know my name?”

Hybrid was in a state between hurting physically and mentally. There was no way he could keep the secret anymore, and he knew that once Torch knew, he wouldn’t possibly disappear quietly. “Because your master told me.” Silvia said, looking the much larger Arcanine in the eyes. “So where is he? What happened to him? What has this Eevee done to him?” “Maybe if you let him have a chance, he could tell you himself.” “Wait, do you mean to tell me…” “Your master is beneath your paw.” Silvia said as she turned her head away.

Torch removed his paw. Hybrid grasped his chest and breathed irregularly. “Silvia… I appreciate the help… but was that really necessary?” Silvia’s looked to the hurting anthro on the floor. “If I didn’t, you would’ve you know… not been here to be missing.” Hybrid’s grip tightend and he started rolling a little bit. “Shit Torch, why did you have to press so hard? I thought you were friendlier than that. Just because I’m missing doesn’t mean destroy everyone without answers.” “How do I know it is you Mark? What happened today that only we would know?” “Other than you tackling me and me giving you pizza in return, not much.”

Torch’s face was lost in expression, from joy to confusion. He cuddled up to Hybrid with tears flowing from his eyes. “Master…” “Quit calling me that. I don’t like being called master. Not to mention that since you just about took me away from this place with one paw, I think that proves how much better you are.” “I’m sorry. I didn’t know it was you.” “Who would’ve, Torch? Nobody. But that doesn’t make it right. I don’t like the idea you’re willing to do so much harm because I’m missing, no matter what the case. I’m actually happier that it was me rather than someone completely innocent.” Torch dropped his head in shame.

“So how did you get out here? I know you don’t leave after it gets too dark and I highly doubt you were just let free for a while.” “They had the door open enough and I got out that way.” “What do you mean by open enough?” Silvia asked? “It means that it wasn’t really closed and he pushed it open the rest of the way. If I get the chance, I’ll show you sometime.” Hybrid responded. “So mas… I mean Mark, how did such a strange transformation occur?” “I wish I knew, but I don’t. I was in the park when I blacked out and this was the result. I’d still be in the park, but Silvia showed up and helped me out.”

Torch walked over to Silvia. “Thank you very much, Silvia was it, for watching over him. I’m sorry we woke you.” “It’s okay. I’m glad I got to meet you.” Torch turned back to Hybrid. “So should we be going Mark and let her be alone?” Hybrid sighed. “Torch. I think we need to go outside and have a talk just you and me. So can you come over here and help me up?” The Arcanine walked over to the Eevee and using his fur as grips, the Eevee stood up and walked outside. Silvia laid down uneasily. She knew what he was going to say to Torch and as true as it was, she’d rather his family be happier than herself.

Torch and Hybrid were outside the cave, gazing into the night sky. “Why do we need to talk? It’s just a quick walk and you know that.” “Because Torch, I can’t go home.” Torch lost all expression. “What do you mean?” “Torch, do you remember that time when you were a Growlithe and Harry brought his Ditto over? Do you remember how we eventually got Ditto to look like you and a human mixed?” Torch’s curiosity had been destroyed and in its ashes remained an unbelievable, yet sorrowful understanding. “That’s why I can’t go home. They overreacted to that and I can’t imagine this would be much different, whether I’m their son or not. And if they don’t, imagine everyone else. People worry about you because of your size, even though you’ve never done any harm to them. Imagine them seeing worry how I look. I need to stay out there, away from people. Silvia is going to stay here with me and she’ll teach me what I need to know to survive.”

Torch looked with a heart-broken gaze. “So is this farewell?” “I knew you watched too many movies with mom. I’m not disappearing, I’m not dying, and I’m not moving away. I will be right here, in this cave unless there is a good enough reason to leave, in which case I would let you know. So come and see me anytime you want, because I’ll be here. Just come by yourself so my parents don’t freak out.” “Well um about that. I was thinking that this week, while I have someone to help me, we could go find a Fire Stone to help me evolve, if that’s okay with you.” Silvia asked, stepping out of the cave. Torch stepped away from Hybrid and towards Silvia. “What are you going to do to him? Why would you leave here so soon after he just moved in?” “Torch! Give her a chance. I understand your fear, because I have it too. But going on a quest would help me understand this world better than this forest could. I’d ask for you to come along, but you must stay with my parents. And you have got to tone down. First you threaten me, now her. I understand what you’re feeling, but I don’t want you to hurt people.”

Torch lowered his head again. “Yes Mark.” “I have one more request before you go home and that’s to call me Hybrid now.” “But your name is Mark. Your parents gave it to you. Do you not like them?” “It’s not that. I’m just not their son looking like this. Mark is human and I’m only half human. So I’d prefer to be called by a fitting name, and Hybrid’s that name.” “Okay then.” “Now get home before mom and dad worry too much about you. They’ve lost one son already. They don’t need to worry about losing their other.” “What do you mean by that?” Torch asked.

“You never connected the dots? You’re like a second son to them, even with all that fur. They’d do anything for you, just like you’d do anything for me. And we’re like brothers, because you have my back and I have yours. So go on home and cuddle up with them for me.” Torch chuckled. “And you say I spent too much time with your mother.” “Oh get home you oversized furball.” Torch laughed as he faded off into the night.

Silvia and Hybrid walked back inside. “Is he going to be alright?” Silvia asked as she got comfortable in her blanket. “I think so. Now that he knows I’m alive and well, he’ll be much better. His biggest problem is going to be trusting you.” Silvia recoiled. “I swear, I have no intention of doing you any wrong.” “You say that but with how well you acted in the park, believing you is a bit of a challenge.” Silvia looked back over to Hybrid. “Why do you find it so hard to trust me?” “Look at it this way. I was on bench and you offered me shelter, even after seeing my true form. You also have accepted everything I’ve told you about myself and you’ve already proven you know how to keep up a good disguise. It’s perfectly natural that I am cautious and paranoid.” “I guess so.” Silvia remarked as she relaxed.
15111112.title: Later that night

151111121.content:
Hybrid rolled around on the hard, gritty floor. ‘Still an Eevee’ he thought to himself as he stood up. The first day in this form and it wasn’t going to be easy: Following around Silvia to find a Fire Stone in territory considerably foreign, while trying to keep up a good disguise. Yes, today was going to be just lovely. He looked around to see the Vulpix still lying down.

He was still questioning whether to trust her or not. As much as he wanted to just disappear and survive on his own, she really was his only good option. If she had any bad plans, she certainly had the trump card. However, she stirred and lifted her head up. “Good morning” She said. “Good Morning.” Hybrid responded. “You still don’t trust me do you?” “Shouldn’t we be going wherever it is you want to go? You aren’t going to gain my trust sitting here all day.” She grinned. “We’re going to go near Lemone. There’s a hot spring that had a few Fire Stones, or at least it did when I left.” “So since your parents are nearby there, are we going to see them at any point?” “I’m not sure yet.”

Silvia stood up and stretched a bit. She picked up her blanket and hid it in one of the open cubby holes. After a bit, she walked out of the cave and Hybrid followed behind her on all fours. Silvia went to a bush and grabbed a berry to eat. Hybrid followed suit, but with his mouth rather than his hands. They finished up and kept going along an unmade trail. The trip started out fairly quiet, with not much being said. However they soon started talking about everything from food to lifestyle to family.

“… Your parent’s humans didn’t spoil you because you’re a Vulpix?” “Yes. Apparently a Vulpix isn’t as beautiful as a Ninetails, so I never really lived ‘the good life’. I wish I could stay with a human.” “Don’t look at me. I had it and lost it. I want it as much as you do, maybe more because I did have it.” “I guess you do have it a little worse. What do you miss the most?” Hybrid took a moment to contemplate it. “I really don’t know. I miss Torch a lot, and my parents, and everything. It’s hard to really pick one thing out.”

“You and Torch seemed really close. Why is that?” “Because I saved his life and he never has left my side since then. In fact, I think yesterday was the longest he’s gone without me being there.” “Was he really that sick?” “He could barely stand. I’m no doctor and I can’t remember clearly, but even the nurse who took care of him was worried.” “Where were his parents? Shouldn’t they have been at his side if he was so young?” Silvia asked. “Don’t know. I’d ask him, but we’re fairly far away and I don’t know if that would be something he’d want to talk abou-oof!”

Hybrid collided with a Flareon who had been holding some berries in a bag, but they then scattered on the ground. “I’m sorry about that. I wasn’t paying any attention. Here, let me help you.” Hybrid said as he picked up the loose berries and put them back into the bag. “Thanks.” The Flareon said as it looked Hybrid in the face. But upon making eye contact, the smile wilted to a sadder expression and the Flareon walked away, head dropped and tail seized.

“Did I not do something right? He looked at me like I was dead or something.” “I don’t know. You didn’t do anything wrong on your part. Maybe he’s just having a rough day.” The two kept walking, taking gentle breaths of the fresh air that enveloped them. It was really beautiful, but Silvia stopped and walked away from the path. Hybrid followed and saw her looking towards the treetops.

“What are you doing?” He asked. “Trying to see what we could eat. I’m hungry.” “And you’re going to climb the tree to get them?” “Well actually let’s see how good you are with doing your attacks. I could get them down myself, but you need some practice so go for it.” Hybrid sighed and looked at the trees. He saw the tree with apples and tried to think of a way to get them. He tried jumping straight up, but fell far short. He attempted to jump off the tree, but that failed too. He head-butted and even stood up and shook the tree with his hands, hoping maybe two would be just loose enough. When that failed Hybrid lied down and thought about it some more when Silvia’s face loomed over his.

“While watching you act like some kind of cartoon character is quite entertaining, I really am hungry. So without further ado, watch me.” Silvia lined up and jumped at the tree just as Hybrid had. However, her jump off was much swifter and she easily had an apple in her mouth. She landed and set it down “You were close when you did it, but you should’ve used Quick Attack instead of just jumping.” “I’m sorry that as a former human, I have no clue how to do anything other than walk and talk and eat and sleep.” Hybrid growled. “Oh don’t be so sore. You still can get your apple. I’ll be sitting here eating mine, watching you.” True to her word she sat there and started to eat, waiting for Hybrid to get up.

He stood up and tried to jump again, following Silvia’s example. He tried to follow Silvia’s example, but instead just jumped off again. “Try thinking how you’re going to actually use Quick Attack. That’s how I do it.” Hybrid tried again and succeeded in the attack. However he fell short of the apple and lined up to try again. He jumped, but once again fell short. Hybrid looked around to make sure that the only one watching him was Silvia. After seeing no one, he stood up back on two paws and climbed the tree. He reached for the apple he so desperately wanted and picked it. He then jumped down and landed in front of Silvia, bowing before he returned to his quadruped stance.

Each of them took a break to eat their apples. “That was using what you got I guess. But in all seriousness, you do need to work on your attacks in case we get in a fight.” “What do I have to learn? I’m a Normal-type. No real special attacks.” “Do as you want, but I really think you should work on it.” “I will. Shall we be going now?” He said as he finished his apple. “Yes. We’re going to need a place to stay for the night and it’s best to look before it gets too late.” “Wait, we’re not going to make it tonight?” Hybrid asked. “If we went until we got there, we’d be tired and it’d be tomorrow afternoon. If we sleep tonight, we can be well rested and maybe able stay with my parents’ tomorrow night, considering their humans will be either asleep or gone.”

The duo kept walking. Many Pokémon saw them on the way and many kept their watch on Hybrid. Some even looked ready for a fight. But Hybrid kept moving, trying to avoid any eye contact. Silvia kept in charge and marched with a sense of pride. However a swarm of Beedrill appeared.

“Can we help you?” Hybrid asked. “Yeah” mentioned of the Beedrill. “You guys can leave.” “We are. We’re heading towards the hot springs.” Silvia said. “No, as in leave right now. Everyone in this forest is nervous you’re going to light this whole place on fire and you’re buddy back there, they just don’t like the look of him.” “We’re just going to stay on this path. No wandering or anything.” “Seriously, leave now or someone’s going to hurt you guys.” Silvia looked up with a saddened cute face; large pupils, lower lip sticking out, and the gentlest voice she had. “Please let us go this way. I just want to go through and see my parents. They live at the hot spring.” The lead Beedrill looked away in weakness. “Fine, but don’t come back this way.” They all left and the duo continued. “See? Being cute has its benefits.” Silvia said. “I wouldn’t know.” Hybrid said.

The journey had been put on pause for the night. The two grabbed a spot near a waterfall, far out of anyone’s sight. “So another day-long trip tomorrow?” Hybrid asked as he washed his fur. “About that long. Depends on how cooperative the forest is.” “You went this way the first time you came through right?” “Yep and they even helped me. But apparently we’re just trouble together.” “Apparently freaks like me aren’t well liked here. First the heartbroken Flareon, now everyone wants us gone. I really should’ve stayed back home.” “Don’t say that. We’re halfway to my parents and besides, when we get to the flatter land we’ll be fine. Let’s get you some practice while there’s a smidgeon of light out.” “Fine then.”

The two went on, working on agility and overall power. However, they trained long into the night and before they knew it, exhaustion reared its ugly head. Hybrid lied down, and got comfortable. Silvia lied down as well, but started shivering. “Are you okay over there? You look cold.” Hybrid said. “Yeah just a bit. This waterfall is blowing cold air on me. Can I sleep with you?” Hybrid sighed. “Fine. Come here.” Silvia walked over to Hybrid and lied in his arms. “You’re so warm. We should do this more often” she said with a giggle. “Just this once, we’re doing this. No other times.” Hybrid said as he wrapped his silver arms around her.
151111121.title: Silvia and Hybrid head out the next morning [edit]

1511111211.content:
Hybrid eyes peeled open. He looked over himself again, but no matter how often he checked, fur took the place of his once-human flesh. It was one fact he would always have trouble accepting.

He slipped his arm from underneath the sleeping Vulpix. He crept over to the water and washed his face. Even with its chill, it felt comfortable and relieved his weary eyes. Hybrid sat down and reflected on the past few days. They had been bothering him a lot, and he figured this would be a perfect time to think things over. In his state of meditation however, he failed to see Silvia stir. She stood up and walked over by where Hybrid was. She splashed herself and began talking to Hybrid, but he didn’t respond. Then she nudged him and he jumped in surprise.

“You were in quite the daze. What were you thinking about? What I’m going to do to you?” Silvia asked, to which Hybrid gave no response. “What’s that phrase the humans said? You’re starting to sound like a broken record, or something like that.” “Maybe I am, but broken records don’t get played.” “What’s it going to take for you to trust me?” “Time. I want to trust you because you’ve been so generous, but I don’t want to trust you and get screwed over. If I have time, maybe it’ll have a better effect on me.” “I just don’t want to be your enemy when I’m trying to be your friend. Let’s get going.”

The two set off again, avoiding as much of the forest as they could. They did well and made it out to a vast plain. The two crossed it, until they came upon a Torkoal, which seemed to be heading the opposite direction. “Tito!” Silvia cried as she ran up and nuzzled the Torkoal. “Ah Silvia. It’s been a few months since I last saw you. How have you been?” “I’ve been doing fine. How have you been doing?” “Tired as always. Who is this traveling with you?” Silvia turned to look at Hybrid. “That’s Hybrid. He said he would help me find a Fire Stone so I could evolve. He’s staying with me until he finds a nice place to live.” “Very unique name. However you seem to be getting the worse end of the deal. But that is your business. I wish I had time to chat, but I must be going. Maybe I’ll see you back in the village.” “Okay. Bye Tito.”

Tito headed towards the forest while the duo headed toward Lemone. “Who was that?” “Tito? He takes care of the village I stayed in while heading toward your town. Really nice guy.” “So you did know someone before you moved?” “Yeah, but I’ve never been able to consider him a friend. He acted like more of a father to me than my real father. He would give me food and comfort while my father barely had time because he was getting his ears rubbed.” “So you don’t like your parents?” “It’s not that I don’t like them because I love them, but they just would be so eager when getting attention from the humans that they would ignore me at times.”

Nothing was said then. Rather the two kept walking and eventually the sun faded into the horizon and the full moon rose to take its place. The world had been lit by the moonlight and Hybrid noticed the ground had changed. It suddenly felt rough and arid. “We’re real close now. It should be just a few minutes until we got to my parent’s house.” Hybrid quietly followed behind, lest he strike that raw nerve again.

They finally came upon a mansion, one that Hybrid recognized as the Wright household. “You live here?” “Yep, and so do my parents and their humans.” Silvia pushed open the gate slightly and Hybrid followed behind. The two walked behind the mansion and went through a door large enough for a Ninetales to go through. Inside the house had been overly decorated. “I still have a hard time to believe you live with the Wrights.” “So that’s their last name. Why don’t you think so?” “Because with all the money they have, it’s hard to believe you had to leave.” “They’re rich? I never saw any form of it. Snobs. Anyway, let’s be quiet. If they’re here, we would regret waking them up.”

The Vulpix and Eevee climbed the stairs, letting their feet make barely a sound. Silvia went towards one end of the building and stood at a closed door. “My parents should be in here, if they’re here at all. Think you can open the door?” “Only if you make sure no one else can see me.” Silvia turned around and looked both ways. Hybrid gave a quick glance both ways before standing on two paws. He then reached for the doorknob and slowly turned it, pushing it just far enough so that it could be pushed open. He then returned to all fours, while Silvia nudged the door open. Inside the two Ninetales were laying on the couch.

“Mother, father, I have returned.” The two jumped off the couch and ran over to their daughter with smiles. Hybrid carefully crept in, checking to see if the Wrights were in here as well. “It is so good to see you again dear. Have you been keeping well?” “I have been. I bathe regularly and I eat as much as I should. Where are your masters?” “They left on their business trip and whatnot. You seem to have come at a lucky time. So have you found a human to reside with yet?” “Not quite. I live without one at the moment. I do however stay with this fellow.” Silvia pointed to Hybrid.

Her parents however, looked less than enthused. “Does he live with a human?” “No.” “Then why are staying with you an out-of-species freak-of-nature stray?” Hybrid had been taken back. Never had anyone been so rude as to insult him to his face. “Father, why shouldn’t I? He offers me companionship and if necessary, I believe he could protect me.” “He is not a human. There is no way he could protect you, nor offer what a human could. The least you could do was return with a pokemon that had a human, but rather you bring HIM back. Now get him out of here and sleep here for the night.” “But father…” “No buts, young lady. Now out with the stray.” “Fine then.” Silvia and Hybrid went out of the room and down to the foyer.

“I’m sorry about all that. I didn’t realize they were so harsh to the un-owned.” Silvia whispered. “You should’ve told them the truth. You do live with me, and I am a human.” Hybrid responded in a similar manner. “Yeah, right. I have no collar or any human type gifts and you may stand on two legs naturally, but they wouldn’t believe it. Would you like to stay in the cellar since we can’t be near each other? It wouldn’t be outside, but my parents wouldn’t know about it.” “No. I appreciate the offer, but I can see I’m not welcome anywhere near here. It probably is better I leave. We’ll meet tomorrow to look for your stone, right?” “You’ll be fine until then?” Silvia asked. “I’ll be fine. You just take care of yourself.” “Okay then. Good night.” “Night” Hybrid replied as he walked toward the door he entered.


Continue the story from…
1511111211.title: The next morning

15111112111.content:
Silvia walked back up the stairs, keeping a slow pace, wishing she would’ve snuck out as well. Rather than staying in the room where her parents were sleeping, she went the opposite way. The Vulpix kept walking until she came on a door marked Thomas and Opal. She snickered to herself. There was plenty of room for the three pokemon that had once stayed in this room, but apparently the door could not possibly hold a third name.

She went in through the door designed, again, for a Ninetales. On stepping though, with the moonlight creeping through the blinds, the room felt alive and as though it were speaking to Silvia. She listened to her parents tell her stories while she slept in her bed. She heard everyone eating what simple and tasty food they had to eat. She recognized the sounds of playtime as she would play with her toys until she did not have the strength to play anymore. She heard it all, as though it were happening now.

But it was not alive, nor were there any sounds. The room was spotless when she felt it still should be cluttered. Her bed was pushed under a table when it should’ve been in the corner where it belonged. Her memories were being corrupted by what her life had become when those same memories should as perfect as they once were. Her life was falling apart. Eighteen years old and all she had to show was how broken she was.

Silvia climbed into the small bed and tried to sleep. But her heart was cracking, her tears cascading, her body froze, and her thoughts betraying her. What happened to the parents she knew, who when she was young, would help others and be caring to both humans and pokemon? Why is the only nice human she knew a mix of human and pokemon? Why did her parents stop loving her? That was the single most scarring thought. “Why don’t my parents love me?” She whispered among the tears. “Why?”

She opened her eyes and realized it was morning. The sun gleamed through the windows, only confirming the changes that had taken place in her old base of operations. She assumed the room had been abandoned by the dusty film on everything, but she herself did not have such a film so what could it have been? Silvia got out of the bed and stretched. She marched over to the old cardboard box and recognized the old doll she used to sleep with. It was a Clefairy and much like her blanket, it was old and well-worn out but she loved it just the same. She picked it up and cuddled it once more before returning it to its box.

Silvia stood in the hallway, looking either way to see if anyone was awake. After no forms of life, she went downstairs and into the kitchen. There she found her parents eating something together. “Morning mother. Morning father.” “Morning dear.” “May I eat with you?” “Of course” her dad said as he passed her some of the food. She took bites off and chewed with her mouth open, enjoying every single bite.

“Chew with your mouth closed. I thought we raised you better than that.” Her mother remarked. “We did. I’ll bet its that boy she has staying with her.” Her father said in response. Silvia finished the bite she had and looked at both her parents. “HE has not done anything to effect me. It’s that unnecessary mannerisms don’t help you survive.” “We were free at one point to you know, young lady. Etiquette was always necessary “I know you were free once. But how many years ago was that?” “We wait 198 years to have a child so she can have the best life possible and here she is back-talking us. I think you need to go to think about what you have that others don’t.” Silvia walked away from the table. “Where do you think you are going?” “Well if you will excuse me, Opal and Thomas, I am going to go back to what my oh-so-loving parents gave me: A trip to the outside world away from the nicer side of life so they can have more time with their humans. I am going to go to find my lower class friends, eat my lower class food, sleep in my lower class home, and survive the lower class way, since that is all I really have.” Silvia darted off. “Silvia!” Her mother cried. “Don’t worry. She will come back. She has loves us too much not to apologize or say goodbye.” Her father said, taking another bite of the food.

Silvia ran outside, tears streaming from her eyes. She comes back to say hi, but the only things they care about is that she had a human for a friend that she never could talk to and that she acted proper, whether she was healthy or not. She slowed down and sat in the grass. She could feel it deep inside: A part of her cracking, breaking away from herself, never to return. She visualized that it looked like those documentaries she had seen when the little piece of solid ice broke off of the larger piece and floated away into the ocean, never to be a part of that bigger piece again. Indeed it was like a part of her had just died. She kept walking, now searching for that anthro Eevee.

Silvia spotted him sitting beneath a tree that was off-property. She ran over to him, drying the tears from her eyes. On closer inspection she saw that he was sleeping. “Wake up!” The Vulpix shouted. Hybrid shook himself awake, and looked around until he made eye contact with Silvia. “Good morning?” “It’s almost noon. Why aren’t you looking for that stone?” “Sorry got into a fight and have been sleeping it off. But I won. And I don’t know these terrains like you do, so I thought we would go together.” Silvia laid down and took a few deep breaths. “Are you alright? You don’t look so good” Hybrid asked. “Yeah. Just tired. Sorry for yelling earlier.” “It’s fine. But should not we be looking for your stone?” “Yeah let’s get started.” Silvia stood up and walked in a direction opposite the mansion, with Hybrid following right behind.

They came on rougher terrain that had a slight warmth to it. “We’re here. If the stones are still here, you should be able to see them sticking out of the ground.” Silvia said, as the Eevee went off in separate direction than she headed.

Hours had passed and the sun fell, with the slightly lesser moon taking its place. Hybrid had come on a stone that glowed in a tranquil orange hue. He was about to reach for it when he remembered if he did, he would more than likely evolve. So rather he called out for Silvia and she came running. “I think I found one.” Hybrid announced. “That’s it alright. So, why did not you use it?” “Because you are the one wanting to evolve, not me.” She put her paw over her face in embarrassment. She touched it with her paw and she became swathed in a bright light. Hybrid looked away, and when his eyes returned, a Ninetales stood where a Vulpix once was.

“How do I look?” Silvia asked. “Like a pokemon.” Hybrid stated, sarcasm evident. “Oh you have such a good sense of humor. Well, it’s late. Let’s go to the village and rest for the night.” “Don’t you want to stay with your parents? I am fine sleeping outside.” “No, we are not going back there. We are going to see Tito and stay with him.” She marched along and the Eevee followed.

Hybrid slowed down to look at the cave they stood by. Silvia went in and saw Tito eating some food. “Tito, we are here.” He stopped to look at them. “Ah it’s you two again. I see you found your stone Silvia.” “Yes I did. Do you mind if we stay here for the night?” “Not at all. The lower level still is waiting to be used again. But why aren’t you staying with your parents? I am sure they can offer you much more than I can here.” “I have my reasons.” Silvia said, trying to restrain her emotion. “Mr. Hybrid, was it? Would you please go downstairs while Silvia and I have a personal talk?” Hybrid complied and as soon he was far out of range, he began to speak.

Silvia sat down and Tito stepped closer to her. “Silvia, you stayed with me for nearly a month. I can tell when something’s wrong. And by how you acted when I mentioned your parent, I would be willing to guess something happened there.” “Why do you have to be so smart?” She stated. “Because I watch over people here. I have to be. Now I know your parents and what happened after the first time you came here, but something made it worse this time.” Tito said as he laid on his belly.

“They don’t love me” Said the Ninetales. “Now Silvia-” “Tito, please listen first. You know how they kicked me out. But this time I went back and after we gave the basic hello and all, they asked about Hybrid. When I said he was un-owned, they said some pretty harsh things. Then after making me kick him out, this morning they cared more about my manners than me.” “Hm, I see. It sounds as though you feel your parents have lost touch with reality and also lost all love for you. Is not that right?” Silvia did not say anything. “Silvia, I could tell you how much your parents love you and how you just don’t see it as that, because those are some facts. But I think you do have a point. They do appear to have lost a sense of life and only see things as needing to be the best. Go get some sleep, child. I’ll have a word with them tomorrow.” “Thanks Tito.” “It’s fine.” Silvia cuddled up to Tito before she joined Hybrid downstairs.

Hybrid looked at her in confusion. “You could not tell me?” “How many people have you told when your life fell apart?” Hybrid gestured for her to come over and see did. She laid down and he started scratching her belly. She could not help relax and smile. It went on until Hybrid fell asleep. Silvia smiled and wrapped herself around him. She had made a fair decision in asking for him to be her friend.
15111112111.title: Silvia's point of view

151111121111.content:
Silvia gently awoke and noticed the little Eevee she had sleeping with her. He would move a bit but then be still. But the thing she noticed most was that he was smiling and clung to one of her tails as though it were some kind of comfort item, like her Clefairy doll. Silvia smiled and laid back down.

Tito however walked down the stairs and noticed the two. “I hate to wake the two of you, but I spoke with your parents Silvia.” Silvia slowly stood up and walked over to Tito. Hybrid’s grip slowly failed and woke up after feeling the tail slide passed his nose. “So what did they say?” “I was surprised at how rude they really were. I made it in there and it went as it did with your friend. They said hello then asked me to leave.” Silvia shook her head. “I thought you were good friends with my parents?” “Oh we were amazing friends many moons ago. But now they apparently don’t need me. What a shame that is.”

“Did you tell them I was here?” Silvia questioned. “Yes I did. Why do you ask?” The Torkoal asked with a questioning grin. “Then we should be going. They’ll come here and start lecturing me. Tito, I think it’s best if you tell them I left when you were talking to them.” “Your parents would leave that estate to come here?” Hybrid said as he stood up “I wouldn’t put it out of mind. We’ll be off Tito. Again, thanks for everything.” The two headed upstairs and were about to leave when Tito stopped them.

“Oh by the way, did you two come through the forest on your way here?” “Yes we did.” Silvia said as she stopped moving. “That explains it all. You were the ones everyone was worried about.” “You know what that was about?” Hybrid asked. “Yes I do. There was a family of Eevee’s who recently lost their youngest one, which you look almost exactly like. They wanted to make sure you didn’t stir up any emotions.” “We’ll be careful going through then.” Silvia and Hybrid then left the cave.

“Halfway there” Silvia noted as she kept walking. “Hey! Hold up!” The Ninetales and Eevee stopped to look behind them, and that is when they saw a familiar face. “You were that Flareon we ran into before. Is there something we can do for you?” “Yeah. Come on home! Mom and Dad want to see you again!” the Flareon took off in a direction and they slowly followed behind him. “What on Earth is he talking about? I bet he’s never even met my mom and dad” Hybrid said. “I’ll bet he’s part of that family that lost their son.” “Great” Hybrid started “A kid missing his departed sibling brings me home to his hurting family just because of some coincidence. Gotta love all these bits of terrible luck.”

Silvia and Hybrid came upon the cave where the Flareon disappeared to. “I really don’t know about this.” Hybrid said giving the cave a look. “I know, but maybe you can offer some comfort or something.” Silvia said as she led Hybrid into the cave. Inside sat a Vaporeon, Jolteon, Flareon and Espeon, all speaking directly to the Flareon.

“We understand you loved him a lot, but you can’t keep fooling yourself with these illusions. First, his scent and now you’re seeing him. Honestly Jack, you’re starting to worry me.” Hybrid looked to see the female voice belonged to the Jolteon. “Now dear, do not cast doubt just yet. Those few berries did bear Lee’s scent and they were picked fresh. As strange as it may sound, there could be a possibility.” The relaxed voice was then tracked to the Vaporeon. “Mom, I have to agree with them. There has been a strange atmosphere since Jack brought those berries home.” “You all saw him not wake up that morning, with all of our efforts and you refuse to accept his de-” The Jolteon stopped to take a look at the guests at the door.

Hybrid froze up. “Nothing can prepare me for this.” He muttered. “It’ll be fine. Now let’s stop looking so foolish and get this over with.” “And who might you two be?” Asked the Jolteon. “I’m Silvia and this is… Hybrid. Jack asked for us to come here.” Everyone moved closer, especially the Jolteon. “I’m Caroline. You know my son Jack, my daughter Melody, and my husband Charles. You look an awful lot like our late son.” “And he has his scent.” “And he feels a lot like him… Spiritually that is.” “So how did that happen? He’s been buried a few days and nobody has been there to disturb his resting place. So why do you have his scent, his look, and supposedly Lee’s ‘feeling’. Why?”

Hybrid just sat there. “I don’t know. I just do. I wish I knew, but I don’t.” “Excuse me, Caroline, if I may ask a question. When exactly did your son pass away?” “About five mornings ago.” Silvia leaned over and whispered to Hybrid. “That was about the same time you ‘blacked out’ and you really do have his scent, as well as your own.” “I know what you’re thinking, but how would that happen?” “I don’t know.” She turned back to the family. “Did Lee have any interests that involved being something other than an Eevee?” “He did fancy the idea of being a human. Strange, but we respected him for it.” Silvia grinned at the Eevee. “Need any more evidence?”

Hybrid gave himself a face full of his own paw. “What I need is for everything to actually be a book so I can read ahead.” “The story is written all around you and continues to be written with each passing breath. What else is there to read?” “The ending. It’s always about how it ends.” “Looking for spoilers ruins the plot.” “And waiting for the ending takes much too long.” “Well, you might as well keep this story moving then. You probably should tell them our little theory.” “Probably should.” Hybrid remarked.

“And what are you two babbling about?” Asked Caroline. “Are you sure you want to know, because we’re thinking over here and the thoughts aren’t exactly normal.” Hybrid responded. All of them nodded. “Well then, listen carefully and be ready to believe anything, because it is going to get strange.” Hybrid swallowed and took a deep breath. Silvia came and wrapped her tails around him, as if to suggest comfort and support. Hybrid stood up on his back paws.

“Well, truth be told, I’m a human. Five days ago, I woke up one morning and left my home to get some outdoor air. I passed out and didn’t wake up until that night. Now what happened after that doesn’t have any effect on you, but it’s the concept of when I passed out that affects you all directly. I mentioned I passed out five mornings ago, which is when you lost your son. So my theory is that-” “You and Lee somehow merged into one body. That does explain the scents and appearance, and all that.” Melody mentioned. “You’re right in the sense of madness. I have a hard time believing such a ridiculous theory. It has no logic whatsoever.” “But mom. It does explain-” “Jack, I don’t want to hear any of this nonsense. We all watched him die and you want to argue he’s still alive!” Caroline stormed out of the cave as Charles sighed.

“I’m sorry about that you two. We all believe you ummm… Hybrid, even my wife does. But like she said, we watched Lee perish. It is hard to believe that you and he are one in the same. But with all these concepts and these strange feelings that I can’t explain, I think we can find a way to believe it. I’m going to, well, find your mother and talk with her about this all. She’s probably taking this harder than anybody realizes. Why don’t you two stay for the night? We’d like to, I guess catch you up on what you don’t know or maybe find out what you live like now.” The Vaporeon left the cave in pursuit of his wife, leaving only the siblings and Silvia.

“So can we meet your human parents?” Jack questioned, causing Hybrid to look off in the distance and remain silent. Silvia took up on the question. “I’m afraid not. Hybrid never got the chance to tell his parents goodbye, and he doesn’t think he can go back because unlike with your parents, there’s no way his parents could recognize him or maybe even accept him. He’s not really a human or just an Eevee, but rather something in between. So he’s staying with me, until he can either find a way back to being human or a way to prove who he is.” “Well, at least you still have our parents and all of us to keep you company.” “Yes I do, but I don’t know anything about them or you. I know I met Jack a few days ago, and I know we’re all related, but that’s all. My memories are only from my human life, not the life of your brother.”

Hybrid’s head dropped a little. Jack and Melody moved in closer to Hybrid. They nuzzled him, showing a form of affection that he had never experienced: An affection that can only be shared between siblings. Something within him grew curious, for with this new affection came emotions he was not highly familiar with, but he most certainly enjoyed feeling them. “Then let’s make some memories, so if you do ever go back to being human, you’ll always know who and where your family is.” Melody remarked.
151111121111.title: At Tito's cave

1511111211111.content:
Hybrid collapsed on the ground with Silvia lying down on her blanket. The duo had just made it back from Hybrid’s new family and his jaw now hung low, what with all the chatting and such he had done. Despite it all though, he felt a sense of satisfaction. The theory may be wrong, but at least he now some explanation for the neighbors when they came asking, even if it was hair-brained.

“So now what?” Silvia questioned as she let out a massive yawn. “I was hoping to sleep for the rest of the night, unless you had some other plan.” “Sounds fine to me. Just one question for you.” “I swear if it’s about this whole cross body-change-thing, I’m going to flip.” “It’s not. I was just wondering if you trust me yet.” Hybrid sighed. “You left your parents to come with me, you’ve been by my side through all these things, and you’re still offering me shelter, so I guess the answer is yes.”

Silvia leapt from her blanket to standing over Hybrid. She nuzzled his face and even lied with him. “I love you too.” Silvia said. “Now hold it. I said I trusted you. Love and trust are two completely different words.” “So you’re going to try and tell me you have no feelings of affection for me whatsoever? I find that hard to believe.” “Well it’s not that I don’t have affection for you, but we’re completely different species. I’m half human and half Eevee and you’re full Ninetales. I think of my affection for you more like a sister or guardian rather than a partner.” “If that’s how you want it to be, I’ll be fine with it. But just think about this: If you don’t have feelings of love for me, then who? Who would love you in your current state?”

“Trying to turn me towards you won’t work, ya know.” “I’m not trying to make you see me as your only option. I’m trying to make sure you’re thinking like you should be. You’re not human enough anymore. You’re more pokemon than human. Your best options for love are with a pokemon now, or at least until you figure out a remedy for your little problem.”

Hybrid swallowed that thought hard. Silvia was absolutely right. No more seeing Sally walk down the halls. He couldn’t go try to win Alexandra over with some smooth moves. He couldn’t even go and talk with all his old chums. The thoughts soon dissipated as his exhaustion overtook him.

Silvia grabbed her blanket and pulled it over the both of them. She really did have feelings for him. It was a hard concept for her to grasp as well, because love between a human and pokemon should never exist. But she couldn’t deny what her heart was telling her. She wanted him, but not for that nice body of his. No, she felt something in him that she hadn’t known for a while: love, and compassion.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------------------

The night had rolled on, as the sunlight had been stripped away so the starlight may cast their beauty on the world. The sounds and sights of the day slammed to a halt as actions of silence and solitude took over. There were three forms however that kept the night alive, with the largest of them taking the lead. The lead figure dashed off towards a cave in the forest outside the city, with the other two figures following clumsily behind, barely keeping the pace of the lead shadow.

The form that had lead the other two wandered into the cave looked around. “Master!? Master, are you here?” Silvia awoke, but Hybrid stayed in his state of slumber. Silvia threw her flame to the torches of the cave, thus lighting up the faces of the figures at the cave entrance. The familiar maw of Torch was easily identified, but the other figures were as well. Silvia leaned into the sleeping form of Hybrid and whispered into his ear “I think you should probably get up.” The Eevee woke up but kept himself concealed beneath the blanket.

“Why would Torch have brought us here, honey? There’s nothing but a sleeping Ninetales.” “I don’t know dear. This is Torch we’re talking about dear. If anybody can find Mark, it’s Torch.” Hybrid knew those voices and he knew what that meant: Torch had brought his parents’ home.

“Torch! What were you thinking?!” Hybrid shouted. Everybody perked up and Silvia recoiled from the intensity of Hybrid’s shout. Torch went rushing over to the lump in the blanket where Hybrid was. “I’m sorry Mark or Hybrid or whatever it is you wish to be called, but I felt it was important.” Hybrid’s parents began asking Torch about Mark and whispering to each other “I hope so, because I was enjoying my sleep, even if it wasn’t at home.” “Come on. Don’t be so bitter or nervous. Just go and show them. It’ll be one less burden off everyone’s chest.” Silvia said as she lowered her maw closer to his face. He dreaded the thought of the meeting, but it did need to be done.

“Hi mom. Hi dad. How have you been?” “Mark? Is that you? Where have you been, young man?” Asked his father. “Well you see, it’s a long and complicated story, which makes no sense whatsoever.” “Did something happen, because if something did happen we’d still love you.” His mother stated. “It’s not a matter of whether you love me or not. The problem is you wouldn’t recognize me, since you didn’t know who I was just a few nights ago. Torch, could you help me up?” Torch lowered his nose and Hybrid propelled himself up. With Torch and Silvia at his side, Hybrid walked up to his parents.

The Arcanine and Ninetales moved away a bit and sat as Hybrid moved up to his parents. “Well here I am. What’ya think? Pretty different, huh?” His parents didn’t move and just stared. “What kind of trick is this? Where are you hiding Mark?” “See Torch, this is exactly why I’ve been here and not going home. They don’t believe me.” “Yes, it would appear so. It seems you were right again.” Torch said humbly. “Have to be once in a while. So mom and dad, what’s it going to take to prove I am who I say I am?”

“I won’t believe it. My boy was a human, not a Ditto or robot or whatever you are.” Hybrid’s dad said. Hybrid stood on all fours and looked up to his parents. “Recognize me now? You know the Eevee Torch almost mauled the other night? He’s not one to attack random Pokemon and you know that. There has to be a reason he almost attacked me that night and led you to this cave. Just think about it.” His parents looked at each other with deep thought.

Hybrid went over to the food stuffs and grabbed a berry to eat, to which Silvia barked. “It’s this late at night! Why are you eating?” “Because I’m hungry.” He replied bluntly. “So, umm Mark, if you really are who you say you are, why have you been hiding out here?” “Because look at me mom, I’m obviously not human and I’m not really a pokemon either. Silvia, the Ninetales right there, was kind enough to offer me hospitality and food.” “So you can talk to pokemon?” “Yes I can. Otherwise I’m sure Torch would’ve brought you both here sooner. But he decided to listen to my request and leave you where you were. Well, until now that is. So what’s so important that he brought you out here?”

“Well, originally since tomorrow was your birthday, we figured we’d let you know that we were planning on moving away from here in the city to a house in the country. Then we would have more room to live. But since you disappeared, we’ve been packing up everything to leave the day after tomorrow.” “Oh” Hybrid said as he rubbed the back of his head. “Torch, I apologize for being so rude. This was important news. Here have a berry since it’s all I can offer you.” Hybrid threw a berry at Torch and he happily caught it between his jaws. Silvia wasn’t quite as happy. “Stop eating my food! We do need to eat at other times rather than just tonight!” “Well Silvia, I think you won’t need to worry about that for too much longer.”

“I don’t know if this matters, but we are going to Lemone. There’s room there and a large yet affordable house. So you are going to come with us right, or is this your home now?” “Well since we’ll be out of city, I’ll come. But it won’t be just us and Torch, but Silvia as well.” Silvia’s eyes lit up. “Do you mean I can live with you?” “You’ve done me a favor. I need to repay the debt. Hybrid’s parents were a bit taken back. “Well then I guess we’ll have to make sure we have room then. We’ll get all your things together and haul them to the house.” “That sounds great. We’ll meet you there because we’re going to walk.” “If that’s what you want dear.” Hybrid moved over to his parents and gave them a hug, as they returned the gesture. “We missed you Mark.” “I know. I have too, and now I can finally come home.” Torch moved in and gestured to Silvia to do the same. After some hesitation, the Ninetales moved into the hug with her new family.

15111112111112.content:
Hybrid and Silvia walked the road they had just traveled days ago. Silvia had barely managed to allow Hybrid’s parents to take her blanket, but she didn’t want to carry it around and have something happen to it. SO She gave it to them and would get it back once she got to her new home. Hybrid however walked with a spring in his step. Now he could go home and be with his family and Torch, and Silvia now was with… He slowed down a bit. He would be with Silvia from now on. Something inside him felt fuzzy. He knew this sensation as affection, but was he really falling for Silvia? She had beauty and personality, but could he truly find his place with her? He tried not to think about it too much, but some thoughts can’t be avoided.

The duo kept walking when Silvia asked a question. “So should we bring your family along with us?” Hybrid stopped completely. “What are you talking about? They’re going there on their own, remember?” “Not them. Your pokemon family. They wanted to meet your human family and we are going there anyway.” “I guess it would be a good idea. But will traveling in such a massive pack be a good idea?” “It won’t be that bad. We can manage.”

Silvia and Hybrid got back to walking. Silvia wanted to be in a home with love and care and friends, and Hybrid wanted to be with his family again. Now they both were getting what they wanted in one simple swing. But certain family members appeared on the road ahead, and Silvia didn’t look too pleased to see them.

Silvia started mumbling things to herself and Hybrid started to fall back a bit, out of caution. The inevitable finally came and Silvia and her parents were staring eye-to-eye. “Where have you been? You run off without letting us know and have Tito attempt to cover your escape. Why are being such a disgraceful wench?” “Because both of you are being arrogant snobs. You have no acceptance of anyone except those with a human. I bet that even then you would look down because they don’t live in extreme wealth.” Silvia snapped. Hybrid said nothing and merely watched as the argument raged.

“Because they don’t understand what they’re missing out on. All they need to do is make a simple gesture and the humans are there to take care of our needs.” “And that also makes me sick. You see humans as tools.” “Because they ask for it dear. They feed you and care for you and all they ask in return is for you to cuddle up to them or do some cute act every now and then. It’s quite simple dear.” “I’m glad you enjoy using them for your pleasure and ignoring all those friends you used to know. I’m going to stay with my human now. I’ll prove why I’m better than you can be.” “Oh you have a human now? Where is it at?” “Maybe if you would’ve come to visit me rather than lecture me, you’d know. C’mon Hybrid” Silvia said as her tails enveloped Hybrid’s smaller form. He could not resist her strength and was trapped in his prison as Silvia took off running.

Hybrid eventually grew irritated and started nibbling on her tails, prompting her to release him. “I can walk, you know.” He remarked. “But we weren’t walking. We were running and you wouldn’t have been able to keep up.” “Do you ever plan on making up with your parents or do you not care what happens to them.” “I have hundreds of years to make it up. I’ll do it when they lose that pompous attitude of theirs.” “I may have a smaller life span, but you’re plan seems stupid. But it’s your life and your choices. And about this whole human thing. Since when do I have any dominance over you or what you do?” “The same way you do over Torch. You don’t control him or boss him around much, but he seems to consider you his master. Besides, I like the thought of being yours.” “Silvia, me and Torch are like brothers. We aren’t like siblings.” “Oh and why not. Is it that you feel… affection towards me?” Hybrid turned away. “Yes.”

Silvia started to rub her maw against him. “Don’t be ashamed. It’s perfectly fine. Especially when my parents find out.” “Now you’re using me like a tool, against your parents.” “No I’m not.” “Silvia, yes you are. I’m now proof to your parents that you’re going to better than them.” “Sorry. I just want to prove to them-” Hybrid cut her off. “That what? You can handle yourself? That you can do things they can’t? Silvia, what’s the point of loving if it’s not love for the other, but the ability to puppet them? I’m not yours to control and use as you see fit. I’m not going to be around you much if it’s going to be a matter of outdoing someone else and I’m just your tool.” Silvia hung her head in shame. “Sorry. I didn’t mean it like that.”

Hybrid ignored her and kept walking. Silvia trotted behind and let the silence remain. Eventually they came upon the cave where his family lived and his ‘little brother’ came outside. “Lee, what are you doing here? I thought you were going home.” “We did, but there’s a change of plans. Is… mom and dad home?” “Yeah and so is Melody. Why do you want to know?” Hybrid gave a sign and along with Silvia, they went in the cave. “Hey uh family I have an announcement. I went home and my… human parents caught up with me. Needless to say, I’m going to be living with them now in our new home and figured you all should come and meet them.” Everyone smiled and agreed to the idea.

“So when would we be there?” “We’re on our way now.” “Then you both should rest here for the night. We can leave early tomorrow and make it there at sunset. Besides, you’re just in time to eat.” Silvia and Hybrid joined everyone and started eating the little bits of food. The cave was alive with chatter and when night came, everyone sat in their own space and drifted off to sleep.

Hybrid woke up earlier than his siblings and Silvia the next morning. However his parents were already up and nibbling on some berries. Hybrid tried to stand up, but felt some weight on him. He noticed Melody and Jack were lying on top of him. Caroline and Charles only smiled. Charles walked over to Hybrid. “They’ve been missing you since you died Lee. They’ve had a hard time coping. And when you showed up and then left the other day, they wanted to follow you home. Now that they’ve got you here, I don’t know if they’ll be able to let you go. You were the baby of the family, now you’re all grown up. It’s feels so strange saying such things, but what else do we have to go on. You don’t have a problem with them lying with you, do you?”

Hybrid sighed. “It’s not so much that they’re laying with me, but that I’m a brother to them based on belief and I don’t know a thing about anything here. I feel kind of… bad.” “Don’t think of it that way. Even if you aren’t really our son somehow, we still will consider you family.” “Thanks, I guess. So, mom and dad, are you ready to meet my mom and dad?” “Yes we are. But how does it feel knowing you have two sets of parents?” “To be honest, I feel like I’m the child of an affair that went horribly wrong.” They both laughed. However everyone started to stir and so the day had officially started.

After everyone had finished, they got up and marched to Hybrid’s house. Hybrid and Silvia led, with everyone else following closely behind. However as they entered Lemone, Hybrid and Silvia stopped, causing the pack to stop moving. “What’s the matter?” Asked Melody. “We kind of didn’t get directions on where to go from here.” Everyone shook their heads in shame. “So what’s the plan then? Just wander around until we find it? It’ll be pitch black at that point.” The Jolteon said. “True. So since that’s one option let’s try a different approach. I used to be able to call Torch with a whistle. Let’s see if I still can.” Hybrid tried to whistle in every way he could. However, the fur on his lips seemed to prevent a decent whistle from coming out. He noticed a blade of grass and quickly changed his method.

He put it to his lips and blew on it just right, creating the whistle he desired. They all waited for a few moments, letting its sound carry on the gentle breeze. “So who is Torch?” “He’s a friend of mine. An Arcanine, but a friend.” “And he’s just going to come because there’s a whistle?” “You’d be surprised. Once more. If this doesn’t work, we wander around.” Hybrid blew on the grass again, letting the whistle chime through the evening air. Everyone sat and waited until the Arcanine came into sight. One second later and Torch was standing directly in front of them.

“So you heard my whistle.” Hybrid said. “I heard more of an ‘I’m lost and come rescue me’. Who are all these other people?” “Well, they would be my additional family.” Torch sat there a minute. “Explain.” He said. “How about we get home and I can tell you and my human parents at the same time.” Hybrid said as he looked around. Torch led them off to a house much farther than anyone expected. But it was a fairly large house. Hybrid saw his parents standing on the porch, waiting for him. He could finally say he was home.
